page.title: 07LANDSCAPE
page.content: BURTON HASTINGS is a small peaceful village on the outskirts of Nuneaton. In the Domesday book Burton Hastings was called Burtone. The word Hastings was added in the 14th century after the people who held the land. The main occupation of thee are has always been farming and it is today. A lot of the land was owned by the Atkins family who have Hosiery factories in Hinckley, but most of the farms are now owner occupied.There are about 60 houses in the village and 7 farms. The church, which dates from the 14th century is built from sandstone from a nearby deserted village called Stetton Baskerville.A school which opened in 1873 closed in 1976 and the 90 pupils were transferred to a school in Wolvey. The secondary school children travel to Bedworth. The old school building is now a private residence.
